alert.note: Alert for Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 20 at 4:13AM PDT until August 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 607 AND 660... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 607 Mt. Hood National Forest West of Cascade Crest. In Washington, Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * WIND...East wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts up to 30 mph. Main wind concerns are for mid and upper slopes; valleys will generally see lighter winds. * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid spread on any new or existing fires. Extreme fire behavior is possible. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This Red Flag Warning was originally issued for dry and unstable conditions, but widespread smoke from wildfires in the region will limit surface heating and thus instability. Dry, offshore breezes and poor humidity recovery are still resulting in critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills
